alert.note: Alert for Western Franklin; Western Hampden (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hampshire, west central Franklin and northwestern Hampden Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Becket, or 13 miles southeast of Pittsfield, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Williamsburg, Huntington, Ashfield, Westhampton, Chester, Chesterfield, Worthington, Goshen, Cummington, Plainfield and Middlefield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
